citation.article-title: Parasegetibacter luojiensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the phylum Bacteroidetes isolated from a forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Parasegetibacter (Pa.ra.se.ge.ti.bac′ter. Gr. prep. para beside; N.L. masc. n. Segetibacter the name of a bacterial genus; N.L. masc. n. Parasegetibacter resembling the genus Segetibacter).
Cells are Gram-staining-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming rods devoid of flagella but motile by gliding.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 39.7 mol%.
Phylogenetically, the genus Parasegetibacter is a member of the family ‘Chitinophagaceae’, phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Parasegetibacter luojiensis.
